intro: Argentina argentea, commonly known as silverleaf tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its bark is often fissured, and it can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Argentina argentea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
